contextId.information: Peter speaks of death as if it were a person who ties people up with painful cords. AT: "having freed him from the pain that death causes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: freeing him from the pains of death

contextId.information: "He is the One heaven must welcome." Peter speaks of heaven as if it were a person who welcomes Jesus into his home. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: He is the One heaven must receive

contextId.information: The apostles used this to show that Joseph was a person who encouraged others. It is used as though encouragement were a person, Joseph's father. The literal meaning of "Barnabas" is difficult to translate as "son of encouragement" and may be more a description of Barnabas.  AT: "a person who always encourages others" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
